author: Special Correspondent
text:
Achyuta Samanta says his aim is to popularise basic and applied science courses in the country.

Dr Achyuta Samanta has been elected as the General President of the 105th Indian Science Congress scheduled to be held in 2017-18.

The election of Dr. Samanta, a noted educationist, who has set up institutions like Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) University and Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS), Bhubaneshwar, was announced at the ongoing 103rd Indian Science Congress.

Dr. Samanta is also currently serving as member of ISCA’s executive committee.

In a statement, Dr.Samanta said his aim was to popularise basic and applied science courses in our country.

“These days, students are getting lured towards engineering and technology and as a result, the basic sciences have taken a big hit. So, my role is now to motivate more and more young minds to pursue basic sciences. The strengthening of basic science courses is directly linked to the development of our country. So, I will personally take interest in motivating students,” said Dr. Samanta in a statement here.

Free residential education

Currently, around 25,000 students are studying in KIIT University where are around 25 programmes are offered. Interestingly, at the Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences, around 25,000 indigenous students are being given free residential education from KG to PG, the statement added.
title: Achyuta Samanta elected ISC president for 2017-18
